lexUnit.name: considerate.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: careful not to harm or inconvenience others

sentence.text: So if you have got your way some of the time by being aggressive and forceful , when you try a more considerate approach you will feel insecure .
Hari felt guilt sear her , she should be more considerate of her mother and yet the work must be done or there would be no money .
Why would peasants be more considerate of their womenfolk ?
Swindon is suffering a plague of illegal encampments , although some gypsies are more considerate than others .
To the men under him he was a most considerate and loyal officer , but he had a darker side to his character .
Our first ride lasted for just 45 minutes ; most of the drivers we met were considerate and took notice of the ` Slow please , young horse message emblazoned on my tabard .
You have been most considerate and co-operative , " he muttered .
Joan Watt did her best -- she 's absolutely wonderful and a very considerate person .
He 's very considerate .
` That was very considerate of you ! "
Few people regard considerate behaviour as in any way manipulative .
It was an extraordinarily considerate gesture .
He decided to return home and become the wealthy and considerate family man .
Fred was a kind , considerate man , uncomplicated and loving in his way , but she regretted that he had never been able really to arouse her fully and take her to the height of passion .
Of course you will grieve for the loss of your child , but I hope you will soon find out how caring and considerate people usually are of a woman in these circumstances .
It was at this period that I began to think about myself in the third person : Elizabeth is compassionate and considerate , she thinks how other people might feel .
She wondered as she climbed into the car whether to mention that it would have been considerate to have the door already open , but she knew what Bri would say -- ` You 're always whingeing on . "

The potash mine is by far the biggest employer in the Whitby and Loftus areas and all local authorities have been considerate in their handling of problems caused by it being on the edge of a national park .
That was rather considerate of her .
` How considerate of you , " she responded with a choked laugh , ` it 's so reassuring to know that you have my welfare at heart .
` I just find it amusing that you 're so considerate to your housekeepers , " she said pointedly .
Germaine lived with her mother and Modigliani was courteous and considerate towards the older woman .
The specialist was caring and considerate towards Adam and explained very carefully the nature of the symptoms and the tests they would be doing .
They chose a quiet country hotel , and walked a good deal , and were considerate with each other .
Be considerate over your handwriting , your computer expertise or lack of it , or anything else which might become an irritation to your fellow workers .
I thought he was being considerate with me , not rushing me .
As fellow creatures on this planet , however , they deserve respect and considerate handling .
Successful road safety campaigns , says the report , are likely to be those that encourage responsible and considerate driving to be the norm .
I 've had two long-term boyfriends since then , both of them considerate lovers .
Theresa Nolan was a gentle , considerate nurse and a competent , but not , I think , very intelligent , young woman .
A considerate Warden was letting each person in turn peep through his telescope .
They were impressed by solid Dave Smart with his air of authority , and the considerate tones in which he had spoken .
You are gentle and considerate .
` He was always so considerate .
` I love him because he is daft , and kind and considerate .
Mark Elder took some time to strike a fair balance between stage and pit and was not always as considerate as he usually is towards the singers .
The headsman , considerate enough to have hidden his sword beneath the straw , then signalled his English assistant to approach the Queen , thereby distracting her attention .
` I ca n't think anyone would have an adverse word to say about him , he was always so polite , considerate and caring to others , " Mr Ivory said .
